leaf_cluster.leaf_cluster_name: 计算系统生物学与动力学生态
leaf_cluster.typical_objects: ODE/PDE 模型, 代谢网络, 信号通路, 参数与不确定性
leaf_cluster.task_chain: 建模→参数估计→仿真→敏感性/UQ→反演→验证
leaf_cluster.tool_form: 建模语言/仿真器 + 参数估计/UQ + 数据拟合工作流

unit.unit_name: 参数估计、模型校准与反演

queries: [WEB] systems biology parameter estimation tools github
[WEB] Bayesian inference for biochemical networks github

tools.name: AMICI
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance interface for ODE model simulation and sensitivity analysis
tools.detailed_description: A sophisticated interface for the SUNDIALS solvers CVODES and IDAS, designed to perform efficient simulation and sensitivity analysis for large-scale ordinary differential equation (ODE) models in systems biology.

tools.name: Benchmark-Models-PEtab
tools.one_line_profile: Collection of benchmark problems for parameter estimation in systems biology
tools.detailed_description: A curated collection of mathematical models and experimental data standardized in the PEtab format, serving as a benchmark suite to evaluate methodologies for data-based modeling and parameter estimation.

tools.name: CosmoABC
tools.one_line_profile: Approximate Bayesian Computation (ABC) sampler for parameter inference
tools.detailed_description: A Python package developed by the Cosmostatistics Initiative for parameter inference using Approximate Bayesian Computation, applicable to simulation-based inference problems.

tools.name: pycotools
tools.one_line_profile: Python interface for the COPASI systems biology toolkit
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolbox that provides an interface to COPASI, enabling programmatic creation, manipulation, and simulation of biochemical network models.

tools.name: pycotools3
tools.one_line_profile: Updated Python interface for COPASI modeling tasks
tools.detailed_description: The successor to pycotools, providing enhanced Python bindings for COPASI to support modeling, simulation, and parameter estimation tasks in systems biology.

tools.name: MATLODE
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB toolbox for ODE simulation and sensitivity analysis
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox providing a suite of ordinary differential equation solvers and sensitivity analysis methods, tailored for computational science applications.

tools.name: ProfileLikelihood.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia package for profile likelihood analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library implementing methods for profile likelihood analysis, used to assess parameter identifiability and confidence intervals in statistical models.

tools.name: Data2Dynamics
tools.one_line_profile: Modeling environment for parameter estimation in dynamical systems
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive MATLAB modeling environment tailored for parameter estimation, model selection, and uncertainty analysis in dynamical systems, particularly for systems biology.

tools.name: astroABC
tools.one_line_profile: ABC SMC sampler for parameter estimation in astrophysics
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of an Approximate Bayesian Computation Sequential Monte Carlo (ABC SMC) sampler, designed for parameter estimation in astrophysical problems but applicable to general inference tasks.

tools.name: PESTO
tools.one_line_profile: Parameter Estimation Toolbox for MATLAB
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox for parameter estimation in dynamical systems, offering various optimization algorithms and visualization tools for systems biology models.

tools.name: fiddy
tools.one_line_profile: Finite difference methods for gradient approximation
tools.detailed_description: A Python library providing finite difference methods for numerical gradient approximation, supporting parameter estimation workflows in computational biology.

tools.name: parPE
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable parameter estimation for dynamical models
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library for high-performance parameter estimation of dynamical models, leveraging MPI for distributed computing and supporting large-scale datasets.

tools.name: pyABC
tools.one_line_profile: Distributed, likelihood-free inference (ABC-SMC)
tools.detailed_description: A Python framework for approximate Bayesian computation (ABC) using Sequential Monte Carlo (SMC), designed for distributed execution and efficient parameter inference in complex models.

tools.name: pyPESTO
tools.one_line_profile: Python Parameter Estimation Toolbox
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Python toolbox for parameter estimation, including optimization, profile likelihood analysis, and sampling for dynamical systems in biology.

tools.name: ABCdiscrete
tools.one_line_profile: ABC optimization for discrete data
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for black-box optimization on discrete data, combining ideas from Approximate Bayesian Computation and Differential Evolution.

tools.name: Catalax
tools.one_line_profile: JAX-based framework for biological system modeling
tools.detailed_description: A JAX-based framework designed to model biological systems, enabling differentiable programming and efficient simulation/optimization of kinetic models.

tools.name: stepmix
tools.one_line_profile: Generalized mixture modeling and clustering tool
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for model-based clustering and generalized mixture modeling (latent class/profile analysis), handling missing values and continuous/categorical data, useful for identifying subpopulations in scientific data.

tools.name: PyDREAM
tools.one_line_profile: MT-DREAM(ZS) algorithm for Bayesian model calibration
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of the MT-DREAM(ZS) algorithm, enabling efficient Bayesian parameter estimation, model calibration, and uncertainty quantification for high-dimensional models.

tools.name: pythonABC
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight Approximate Bayesian Computation library
tools.detailed_description: A Python library implementing Approximate Bayesian Computation (ABC) algorithms for parameter inference in simulation-based models.

tools.name: PEtab
tools.one_line_profile: Data standard for parameter estimation in systems biology
tools.detailed_description: Defines a standard format (based on SBML and TSV) for specifying parameter estimation problems in systems biology, facilitating interoperability between modeling tools.

tools.name: libpetab-python
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for handling PEtab files
tools.detailed_description: A Python library providing functionality to read, write, validate, and manipulate PEtab files, serving as a reference implementation for the PEtab standard.

tools.name: petab_select
tools.one_line_profile: Model selection extension for PEtab
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool and extension to the PEtab standard for specifying and performing model selection problems in systems biology.

tools.name: petab_test_suite
tools.one_line_profile: Compliance test suite for PEtab support
tools.detailed_description: A test suite designed to verify the compliance of software tools with the PEtab standard, ensuring correct interpretation and processing of parameter estimation problems.

tools.name: petabvis
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization tool for PEtab data
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for visualizing PEtab problem definitions, including measurement data, simulation conditions, and parameter bounds.

tools.name: DiffEqParamEstim.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Parameter estimation for differential equations in the SciML ecosystem
tools.detailed_description: A component of the SciML ecosystem providing parameter estimation tools for differential equations, offering various loss functions and optimization methods.

tools.name: GlobalSensitivity.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Global Sensitivity Analysis (GSA) library for Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library for performing Global Sensitivity Analysis (GSA) to assess how uncertainty in model output can be apportioned to different sources of uncertainty in model input.

tools.name: SciMLSensitivity.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Sensitivity analysis and adjoints for scientific machine learning
tools.detailed_description: Provides sensitivity analysis and automatic differentiation support for differential equation solvers, enabling gradient-based optimization for scientific machine learning applications.

tools.name: StructuralIdentifiability.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for structural identifiability analysis of ODE systems
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package for fast and automatic structural identifiability analysis of ordinary differential equation (ODE) models, determining which parameters can be uniquely estimated.

tools.name: StrikePy
tools.one_line_profile: Python toolbox for structural identifiability analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolbox for analyzing structural properties of nonlinear models, including identifiability and observability, ported from the STRIKE-GOLDD MATLAB toolbox.

tools.name: STRIKE-GOLDD
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB toolbox for structural identifiability and observability
tools.detailed_description: STRuctural Identifiability and observability of non-linear Kinetic Energy models (STRIKE-GOLDD) is a MATLAB toolbox for analyzing structural properties of nonlinear ODE models.

tools.name: sf3dmodels
tools.one_line_profile: 3D modelling package for star-forming regions
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for 3D modelling of star-forming regions, allowing the construction of complex geometries and physical properties for radiative transfer simulations.

tools.name: WHAM
tools.one_line_profile: Weighted Histogram Analysis Method for free energy profiles
tools.detailed_description: A Python package to construct free energy profiles from biased molecular simulation data using log-likelihood maximization and self-consistent iteration approaches.

tools.name: AMICI (Azizi Lab)
tools.one_line_profile: Cell-cell interaction inference from spatial transcriptomics
tools.detailed_description: A tool for inferring cell-cell interactions from spatial transcriptomics (ST) data using a cross-attention-based approach.

tools.name: COPASI
tools.one_line_profile: Software for simulation and analysis of biochemical networks
tools.detailed_description: COPASI (COmplex PAthway SImulator) is a software application for simulation and analysis of biochemical networks and their dynamics, supporting ODEs and stochastic methods.

tools.name: BASICO
tools.one_line_profile: Simplified Python interface to COPASI
tools.detailed_description: A simplified Python interface to COPASI, allowing users to create, manipulate, and simulate biochemical models using COPASI's backend from Python.

tools.name: dMod
tools.one_line_profile: Dynamic modeling and parameter estimation in R
tools.detailed_description: An R package for dynamic modeling and parameter estimation in the context of systems biology, supporting ODE models and profile likelihood analysis.

tools.name: KissABC.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient Approximate Bayesian Computation in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A pure Julia implementation of Multiple Affine Invariant Sampling for efficient Approximate Bayesian Computation (ABC).

tools.name: GenSSI
tools.one_line_profile: Generating Series for testing Structural Identifiability
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox for structural identifiability analysis of non-linear dynamic models using generating series approaches.

tools.name: LikelihoodProfiler.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Identifiability analysis and confidence intervals in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package for practical identifiability analysis and confidence intervals estimation using profile likelihood methods.

tools.name: RaptorX-3DModeling
tools.one_line_profile: Protein structure prediction tool
tools.detailed_description: A tool for protein structure prediction (3D modeling), part of the RaptorX suite.

tools.name: abcpmc
tools.one_line_profile: Approximate Bayesian Computation Population Monte Carlo
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of Approximate Bayesian Computation (ABC) using Population Monte Carlo (PMC) for parameter inference.

tools.name: SignatureABC
tools.one_line_profile: Approximate Bayesian Computation (ABC) using path signatures for summary statistics
tools.detailed_description: A Python library implementing Approximate Bayesian Computation (ABC) where path signatures are used as summary statistics for time-series data, facilitating parameter estimation in stochastic models.

tools.name: CoRC
tools.one_line_profile: High-level R API for the COPASI biochemical simulator
tools.detailed_description: The COPASI R Connector (CoRC) provides an R interface to the COPASI software, enabling biochemical network modeling, simulation, and parameter estimation directly from the R environment.

tools.name: slicedwass_abc
tools.one_line_profile: Sliced-Wasserstein Approximate Bayesian Computation
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of Approximate Bayesian Computation (ABC) utilizing the Sliced-Wasserstein distance, offering an alternative metric for likelihood-free inference in complex models.

tools.name: sbinn
tools.one_line_profile: Systems-biology-informed neural networks for parameter identification
tools.detailed_description: A framework combining neural networks with systems biology models to perform structural identifiability analysis and parameter estimation for ordinary differential equations (ODEs).

tools.name: ApproxBayes.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Approximate Bayesian Computation (ABC) algorithms in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package providing various Approximate Bayesian Computation algorithms for likelihood-free inference, suitable for parameter estimation in simulation-based models.

tools.name: ABCdeZ.jl
tools.one_line_profile: ABC with differential evolution and model evidence estimation
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library for Approximate Bayesian Computation that incorporates differential evolution moves and provides estimates for model evidence (Z), aiding in model selection and parameter inference.

tools.name: ABC-DLS
tools.one_line_profile: Deep Learning assisted Approximate Bayesian Computation
tools.detailed_description: A framework combining Deep Learning (TensorFlow Keras) with Sequential Monte Carlo for Approximate Bayesian Computation, aiming to improve efficiency in likelihood-free inference.

tools.name: pyABC
tools.one_line_profile: Distributed, likelihood-free inference (ABC-SMC)
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Python framework for distributed Approximate Bayesian Computation (ABC) using Sequential Monte Carlo (SMC), supporting massive parallelization and adaptive population strategies.

tools.name: mapsTo3DModels
tools.one_line_profile: Workflow for converting geologic maps to 3D models using GemPy
tools.detailed_description: A workflow tool leveraging GemPy to construct 3D geological models directly from geologic map data, facilitating structural geology analysis and visualization.

tools.name: 3Dmodel_scripts
tools.one_line_profile: Scripts for automated 3D printing workflows of scientific models
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Python scripts used in the NIH 3D Print Exchange workflows to process and prepare scientific 3D models (e.g., molecular structures, anatomy) for 3D printing.

tools.name: SBML2Julia
tools.one_line_profile: Translator from SBML/PEtab to Julia for ODE parameter optimization
tools.detailed_description: A tool that translates systems biology models from SBML and PEtab formats into Julia code compatible with JuMP, enabling efficient parameter optimization of ODE models.

tools.name: probdiffeq
tools.one_line_profile: Probabilistic ODE solvers in JAX
tools.detailed_description: A library providing probabilistic numerical solvers for differential equations using JAX, enabling calibration, uncertainty quantification, and integration with the JAX scientific computing ecosystem.

tools.name: SIAN
tools.one_line_profile: Structural Identifiability ANalyser for ODE models
tools.detailed_description: A software tool for assessing the structural identifiability of ordinary differential equation (ODE) models, helping researchers determine if model parameters can be uniquely estimated from data.

tools.name: Sparcle
tools.one_line_profile: Spatial reassignment of transcriptomic spots via profile likelihood
tools.detailed_description: A tool for the spatial reassignment of spots to cells in transcriptomic images using profile likelihood estimation, improving the accuracy of spatial transcriptomics data analysis.

tools.name: cabinetry
tools.one_line_profile: Design and steer profile likelihood fits for High Energy Physics
tools.detailed_description: A Python library to design and execute profile likelihood fits, primarily for High Energy Physics (HEP) analysis, managing workspace creation, fitting, and visualization of results.

tools.name: PEtab.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia interface for PEtab parameter estimation problems
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package to import and work with parameter estimation problems defined in the PEtab standard format, facilitating the calibration of ODE models in systems biology.

tools.name: LRmix Studio
tools.one_line_profile: Expert system for interpretation of forensic DNA profiles
tools.detailed_description: An open-source expert system for interpreting complex forensic DNA mixtures using likelihood ratio models, accounting for allelic drop-out and drop-in uncertainties.

tools.name: Spatial Model Editor
tools.one_line_profile: Editor and simulator for spatial bio-chemical reaction models
tools.detailed_description: A software tool for creating, editing, and simulating spatial bio-chemical reaction models, supporting SBML and providing visualization of reaction dynamics.

tools.name: AbcSmc
tools.one_line_profile: Sequential Monte Carlo ABC with Partial Least Squares
tools.detailed_description: A C implementation of Sequential Monte Carlo Approximate Bayesian Computation (ABC-SMC) utilizing Partial Least Squares (PLS) for efficient parameter estimation.

tools.name: procoli
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for extracting 1D profile likelihoods from cosmological data
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to extract and analyze 1D profile likelihoods for cosmological parameters using MontePython, aiding in the statistical analysis of cosmological models.

tools.name: yaml2sbml
tools.one_line_profile: Converter for ODE models from YAML to SBML format
tools.detailed_description: A Python utility designed to convert Ordinary Differential Equation (ODE) models specified in a human-readable YAML format into the Systems Biology Markup Language (SBML) standard, facilitating model interoperability and usage with SBML-compliant simulation tools.
